questions.question: From whose perspective is the story told?
What 2 actions support Peg is a loving person?

choices.answer: She showered B.J. with loving attention.
She wrote and sold the Dog Newspaper.
She interviewed every neighbor with a dog.
She spent hours making a gingerbread house for B.J.

questions.question: What is a synonym for the word destruction?
Why does the narrator view the neighborhood dogs as boring?

choices.answer: They put on dog shows for the neighborhood.
They follow the same routine every day.
They do tricks other dogs can't do.

questions.question: How does the narrator view BJ’s past life experiences?

choices.answer: B.J.'s past is unique, interesting, and facinating.
B.J's past is the same as any typical dog.

questions.question: What is a synonym for the word career?
Why does the author stop writing The Dog Newspaper?

choices.answer: She could not find interesting stories to write about.
People were buying too many copies.
She could not keep up with the work load.
She did not want to be a author any more.

questions.question: Based on Peg’s actions towards B.J., what type of personality does the narrator portray?
Which 2 sentences support that Uncle Bill and his comrades enjoyed having BJ in their company?

choices.answer: BJ grew bigger and stronger as he traveled with the soldiers
BJ offered love and laughter to a group of lonely soldiers
They named him B.J. because he was a Big Job to take care of
The men decided to keep BJ as the company mascot

questions.question: What is the meaning of the word background when applied to someone's life?

choices.answer: Something a person has never seen or experienced
What they chose when they take their spring pictures

questions.question: What details support the idea that Peg showered BJ with loving attention? Select all that apply

choices.answer: I kept the box to create a special house for BJ
I took him for walks, and read aloud to him
I brushed him, tied ribbons on his collar

questions.question: What is a synonym for the word uneventful?
